intro: Grastidium klossii, commonly known as the Kloss's grass, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Grastidium klossii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
